main event: A yellow object, the size of a pea held at arm's length, was observed falling like a flare in Snowhill, Maryland on 25 February 1955.
interesting points: The sighting was made at night and lasted only one second., The object was observed using ground radar., The object disappeared after the initial observation., The report mentions the possibility of the object being an aircraft or a balloon., The observation was reported by one civilian.
witness description: one civilian who observed the event
